name: RUM - Unusual Spike in Windows Errors

alertDefProperties.name: RUM - Unusual Spike in Windows Errors
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert monitors unusual spikes in window-level JavaScript errors captured through Real User Monitoring (RUM) data. These errors often reflect uncaught exceptions that impact application functionality and degrade the user experience.

The alert is triggered when the number of window errors surpasses a defined threshold (e.g., 100 errors) within a set monitoring window (e.g., 1 hour), significantly deviating from historical norms.

Monitoring this metric helps identify frontend stability issues early, ensuring a reliable and error-resilient user experience.

Customization Guidance:
  - Threshold: Set the error count threshold based on your application's baseline error rate and acceptable stability margin.
  - Monitoring Period: Use shorter intervals to detect sudden spikes or longer ones to monitor persistent error trends.
  - Notification Frequency: Configure to notify only on consistent or severe spikes to avoid excessive alerting from transient issues.

Action: If this alert is triggered, examine recent code deployments, third-party script behavior, and browser compatibility issues. Use error logs and stack traces to locate the root cause and implement targeted fixes.

simpleFilter.luceneQuery:
coralogix.metadata.subsystemName:"cx_rum" AND cx_rum.event_context.source:"window"
 AND cx_rum.event_context.type:"error" AND _exists_:cx_rum.error_context.error_message && _exists_:cx_rum.error_context.error_type
